metadata.synopsis: An English stripper (Emily Lloyd) and a GI deserter (Kiefer Sutherland) go on a thrill-killing crime spree in 1944 London.

reviews: the film is too artistic for its own good while claiming to recreate events and characters faithfully. Once the premise is established, however, the narrative achieves the "true crime" tone it is reaching for and the film becomes much more satisfying, esp
I didn't feel as if the two characters were really acting out of their own spontaneous impulses; instead, they seemed to be guided by the writer and director.
